name: panoramically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has or allows you to see a view of a wide area, or to look at the whole of a subject: The castle was panoramically situated high above the town to look down on its enemies. From his station at the top of the tower, the sentry cast his eye panoramically over the surrounding land. Panoramically, the country's long history looks like one long disaster.
More examplesFewer examplesThe camera sweeps panoramically over snow-capped peaks, vast plains, and huge walled cities. The novel's vast scope panoramically takes in all of the stories that made up New York City in the 1970s.
